OS.question: Describe how an interrupt is handled by the CPU.
OS.answer:
Any four from:
The CPU completes the current fetch-execute cycle
The contents of the registers (PC/ACC) are saved
... to the stack
The source of the interrupt is identified
The appropriate Interrupt Service Routine (ISR) is called/executed
Once the ISR is complete, the saved register values are restored
... from the stack
The CPU continues with the next instruction of the original program

OS.question: Compare CLI and GUI with one advantage of each.
OS.answer:
CLI:
Allows precise control via commands
... uses fewer system resources

GUI:
More intuitive/easier for beginners
... allows WIMP interactions (windows, icons, menus, pointer)

Languages.question: Compare compiler and interpreter.
Languages.answer: A compiler translates the whole program into object code before execution; an interpreter translates and executes line by line at runtime.

Languages.question: State two advantages of using a High-Level Language (HLL) compared to a Low-Level Language (LLL).
Languages.answer:
Any two from:
Easier to understand/read/write (for humans)
... as it uses English-like statements
Easier to debug/find errors
Portable/machine independent
... code can run on different hardware without rewrite

Software.question: Explain the difference between system software and application software.
Software.answer: System software manages and supports computer operations; application software performs user-facing tasks.

Software.question: State one advantage of open-source software and one advantage of proprietary software.
Software.answer:
Open-source: free to use/modify; community support; transparency.
Proprietary: dedicated vendor support; regular updates; polished features.
